title: Keep EHC plans for special educational needs, MPs say
description: Concerns grow over the government's plans to reform special needs education in England.
content:
Individual care plans for children with special educational needs, known as education, health and care plans (EHCPs), should not be scrapped, say MPs.
The Education Select Committee report also calls for new minimum standards of support for special e... [4008 chars]

title: Liverpool 3-2 Atletico Madrid: Alexander Isak samples Anfield power in Champions League win
description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot enjoys a dramatic birthday as record signing Alexander Isak samples Anfield's Champions League power, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.
content:
Arne Slot has no hair left to lose but the man celebrating his 47th birthday might have been left feeling a few years older as his Liverpool team put him through the wringer again.
In the end, however, Liverpool were able to make it many happy return... [5034 chars]

title: Interest rates expected to be held by Bank of England
description: The Bank rate was cut in August but many analysts do not expect any further reductions this year.
content:
Interest rates are widely expected to be held at 4% when policymakers at the Bank of England meet on Thursday.
The Bank rate, which heavily influences borrowing costs and savings rates, was cut from 4.25% to 4% by the Bank's Monetary Policy Committee... [1985 chars]

title: Starmer to recognise Palestinian state ‘after Trump state visit’
description: Other nations including France, Australia and Canada plan to take the same step at next week’s UN summit
content:
Keir Starmer will reportedly recognise a Palestinian state over the weekend after Donald Trump concludes his state visit to the UK.
The prime minister has previously said he plans to recognise Palestinian statehood before the UN general assembly in N... [2350 chars]

title: Could the Federal Reserve interest rate cut boost the US housing market?
description: Borrowing costs are not guaranteed to come down much more than they already have, even after this week's rate cut.
content:
Aileen Barrameda is planning to buy a house in Los Angeles in the coming months. Stubbornly high mortgage rates - twice what she locked in at the start of the coronavirus pandemic - are not putting her off.
"If I have the means to get in the market, ... [4462 chars]
